New Records: Virat Kohli surpassed Sachin Tendulkar's record of most ODI centuries with his 50th century.
Mohammed Shami took seven wickets, marking a significant achievement in the match.
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli scored 117 runs, surpassing Sachin Tendulkar's record.
Shreyas Iyer scored 105 runs off 67 deliveries.
Mohammed Shami took 7 wickets for 57 runs.
Daryl Mitchell scored 134 runs for New Zealand.
Kane Williamson scored 52 runs before being dismissed.
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli expressed his disbelief and joy at surpassing Tendulkar's record.
Kane Williamson praised India's performance and acknowledged the difficulty of chasing 400 runs.
Williamson reflected on the team's effort and the disappointment of exiting the tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India remains undefeated in the World Cup and advances to the final.
India's victory means they will play either Australia or South Africa in the final.
